name: Rio All-Suite Hotel & Casino

reviews.title: Riolly disappointed
reviews.text: There were some problems with the room at first It seemed to have been used and not cleaned when we first arrived so we asked for a differant room. Much better, vary nice but we were told there were no Queen beds available but when we complained about the room we were given they then gave us a nice clean room with queen beds.

reviews.title: Good Hotel - Do Not Gamble !
reviews.text: When check out day came I called down to ask about shuttle service to the airport and was told there was no shuttle service to the airport without reservations and we were to late, and would have to hire a taxi. When we went down to hire a taxi there were several shuttles lined up just waiting to take people to the airport. and were told by the shuttle drivers they came by every 10 min. This misinformation is the vary reason I would never stay at the Rio again, its just not the service I would expect from a hotel that charges two hundred a night for two. We were vary disappointed.

reviews.title: Rio Surprised-Riolly Dissapointed!!
reviews.text: Just read a review that confirmed my suspicions. We were at the Rio in October for a business meet. Four of us dropped more our first night than we planned for the week long stay! I played slots and Roulette and friends played cards. The following nights I just observed and winnings seemed few and far between. Other business assoc had same quick and brutal loosing experiences.

reviews.title: Rio (Remodeled Room) and restaurants review
reviews.text: Will not gamble here on next trip!!

reviews.title: Rio is just "ok"
reviews.text: Upon check in we found out all Suites W/2 Queen beds were occupied, so we were given a 4th floor smoking room! Our Reservations were made in October for Xmas Eve & X-mas Day. The room we found was a disaster, Ghetto like sheer curtains, the Beautiflul view of Rio's Mega-plex air-conditioning unit was sickening, Coffee stained carpet and , a bed that looked like a 5 year-old made! We called the Staff to report our displeasure, and were give a room 15 floors abve that unit ,With 2"QUEEN BEDS", the room was an improve ment but not worth the $$ . Room Service was great and the Food -3 Stars for breakfast! the slots were a lot of fun and every one there was having a blast. the location was not so good and the Shuttle was a little hassle to cut time on a short Holiday. The Staff and Management were really not orginized, and all our questions and help we needed was not recognized ,maybe because we were just John-Q Citizen and not the High-Rollers they pamper. We will never return to Rio again as it was poorly orginized staff wth no Idea what was going on, or how to please a customer, My advise is to find a place closer to the Strip and get a Guarentee on what room you are to stay in and not be Decieved by your Travel Agent or Pictures you see on the Web!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did a timeshare and the Rio was an option for us to stay at. What a great choice that was! Huge rooms with everything you need, really fun shows,bars,casino and, a great FREE show. The "worlds largest buffet" is very large,and costly yet very so-so on the food meter. There is a shuttle that takes you back and forth to the strip so you don't need to rent a car. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: This is a Great place

reviews.text: From Michigan
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay Enhanced By Wonderful Employees

reviews.text: A wonderfully helpful staff. Had a request at checkin that was handled professionally and courteously which set the tone for each employee that I encountered over the four days. Someone has done an excellent job of hiring and developing a superb group of employees.
reviews.title: Lousy Customer Service

likes.disliked: — lousy customer service left me hating the entire experience

reviews.title: Much Better than other reviews indicated
reviews.text: If you stay at the Rio, do not use the concierge. I asked for a ticket to see Blue Man Group. The concierge told me that they had Premium seats in the 10th row, and showed me the location on the seating chart by putting his finger in the center of the front section. When I picked up my ticket for the show, my seat was on the 10th row, but was against the right side wall with a restricted view (probably about 20% not viewable) of the stage. When I returned to the Rio, I attempted to resolve their error, I got the run around for three days. I finally had a response the next week, which was basicly, the computer picks the tickets, so it wasn't their problem. I pointed out that I would never had paid $135 for a show when I couldn't see all of it and the concierge that sold me the ticket had misrepresented the location. That was six weeks ago and I am still waiting for a response. I also attempted to go though the Rio front desk, but was told it was not their problem. An additional attempt to get a response from them has also been ignored. The way I was treated, I wouldn't stay at the Rio again if it was free.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we recieved an offer for a 4 day, 3 night comp stay at Rio, I checked the reviews and was very hesitant about taking it. We've never stayed at Rio before and had only visited once. We've stayed at Bally's, Bellagio and Harrahs in the past.
reviews.title: Thin Walls and Ceiling.

likes.disliked: — Thin walls, no housekeeping, lack of decent after 10pm cafe, restaurant.

reviews.title: finally made my trip..
reviews.text: finally made my trip out to vegas!! i was comped a suite for 2 nites, but fri was full so i had to settle for sat & sun.. i didnt need a sun. stay so i just checked out sun morn. they didnt have a problem with that and they never needed any type of deposit for the room so i was happy with that. the check-in process was fairly easy we got there at 5 pm and it was a breeze.. im a platinum player so i could have used the platinum check-in but there was no reason to. the registration and check-in staff were the absolute best and they answered every question; however a trick i learned from watchin others is to demand the very best rooms that are newly remodeled, ask for rooms closest to the elevators and a must is to ask for the masquerade tower. if i would have known those goin in i would been better off. so if u plan on goin please remember to ask for exactly that!!! but overall the room was excellent, i stayed on the 5th floor of the ipanema tower, we had problems parkin the car and finding our room at first tho. as with the rest of vegas the hotel is huge! we kept parkin on the backside of the hotel and ended up havin to take a sidestreet just to find the front/entrance to the casino. you have to establish some landmarks inside the casino to avoid gettin lost!! nevertheless the trip from the car to your room could be a potential adventure in itself! in particular i didnt like the overall atmosphere of the casino. there werent many gamblers just a bunch of wannabe-hollywood types lookin for attention. keep in mind that its a younger crowd but there was no indication that this was a singles crowd. personally i grew tired of the skinny, silicon-implanted variety of women that hung-out and worked here.. being from atlanta i just grew tired of the types of women that were there. i tried striking up convo. with several women but they were very superficial and just needed a break from the l.a./vegas scene. there were some unusual minimums on some games however.. i normally play roulette and there were some with $10 mins. and some had $25 mins(which i thought was kinda strange because that would discourage play) but i did win good money playin and i did manage to put some away.. after walkin around if found nothing better to do than gamble so i started again, i returned to roulette and continued to win. i got highly upset when i wasnt comped a simple cigar.. even though i toted away alot their money they should have been professional enough to comp me a simple cigar. so i cashed in and stormed away after this incident.. my advice would be to steer clear away from the slot machines, consequently i didnt see a soul win a red cent playin slots.. i never got the party vibe while at this casino/hotel everything just seemed so rehearsed and mechanical.. there were alot of couples and the single people didnt seem comfortable in meeting others. i should have used the rio as simply a place to rest my head for the nite because there are hundreds of much better partys and spots in vegas.. overall the room was excellent and service excellent as well i must say. being that there are hundreds of hotels/casinos in vegas, unless comped a full stay i would probably never pay to stay in my lifetime.

reviews.title: RIO OKAY CASINO NEEDS HELP
reviews.text: I just got back from Las Vegas Jan2-6,2005. I stayed at the Rio for 2 nights. The room was spacious. It was clean and comfortable and the bed was great for sleeping if you are able to sleep in Vegas. The bathroom was alittle disappointing when researching this hotel I saw that it was to a have a jacuzzi tub. It did not have that. It did have a separate vanity and dressing area but the bathroom was small. Service was good but I was on a Travel Agent rate so they know who I am and want to service me so I will refer people them. The Casino is small with alot of tables ( black jack, poker and craps.... ) Many the lowest bts are at $15. I did eat twice there and have to say food was great and service was okay not the best but okay.

reviews.title: Loved the Rio
reviews.text: We stayed at the Rio Dec. 26 through the 30th. The room could not have been better. We were on the 11th floor of the Mascarade Tower. It was clean, spacy and nicely appointed. The staff was courteous, and were very efficient. I am so surprised to read other reviews about how they were disappointed. We certainly were not! We are not big gamblers but received two free nights, one at $19 and one at $60. We mostly play 2 and 5 cent slots, so this was an amazing deal for us. Again, great stay!

We've wanted to stay here for a long time, but never had the chance. This time the rates were great, so we went for it. Stayed here just one night, wish it had been more. The room was clean and comfy. The desk clerk was very friendly and the housekeeping staff was super about bringing things by. No problems here. We loved the room and would certainly stay again
reviews.title: Great time
Horrible service at the Rio
reviews.text: We just got back from spending a few days in Las Vegas. We were there 3 nights, and stayed at a different hotel each night. Our last night was at the Rio. It was by far the worst hotel with the worst service we have ever encountered in Las Vegas.

reviews.title: Loud and smelly.
reviews.text: It's the Rio, and I for one will not be returning.

reviews.title: Try the Rio
reviews.text: As soon as we walked in the door I knew I'd be glad to leave. The music was turned up too loud and (early in the evening) the place was already permeated with smoke.

reviews.title: Loved the Rio!
reviews.text: They didn't have the room I reserved. I booked a kingsize, they gave me 2 queens (though why someone would want 2 queens in a room for 2 people is beyond me). Apparantly the website indicates they don't actually hold the room but neither the person taking my reservation on the phone, or the receipt had any such information.

reviews.title: Beware of false charges
reviews.text: The room was somewhere south of acceptable. A jar of rancid milk was left sitting outside our room (presumably from the last guests, or just a nearby room who no longer wanted it near their door?) for our entire two day stay. For it's "suite" nature, the whole bathroom area was pretty cramped, though having the two sinks was admittedly a nice touch.

reviews.title: Spacious rooms, great cafe and buffet
reviews.text: Downstairs, no matter how much others rave about the "masquerade in the sky" it's just a bunch of carts on wheels filled with folks who, when it's dark, do something that almost passes for dancing. Not enough to impress me, and definitely not enough to warrant the very optimistic "best free show" label that is so lavishly applied to the spectacle.

reviews.title: Great Hotel for the price, can't be beat!
reviews.text: Just got back from 4 days in Las Vegas. Picked the Rio, for $45 internet

reviews.title: Totally unprofessional
reviews.text: room rate, which for the size of room, 600 st. ft. could not be beat anywhere. Checked in around 11pm, not problem, took only 2 minutes,

reviews.title: Win at Rio
reviews.text: front desk clerk, was from the Phillipines, and went out of her way to find us a very nice room on the 10th Floor, with a view of the strip. Rooms are not Suites, but probably the largest rooms in Vegas, for the least money. 36 inch TV's nice King Bed, leather padded Headboard, in room Safe, large vanity area, in room refriderator, which is handy if you want to some food from room service to eat later, very nice large and compfy L Shaped sofa. Room was very clean, and housekeeping very good. Casino was realtively quite, ceiling low, and a bit smoky for my liking. Breakfast in restaurant done the hall from the main showroom, where Penn + Teller perform, was very nice food terrific and fast, but expensive. Free Shuttle service to Harrah's very efficient, came every 5 minutes, and a great service!Went to Bellagio, this is the place to play blackjack you can get $5 or $10 tables, without too much trouble, dealers really nice and friendly, Hotel is the nicest in Vegas, as far as the Casino and Public areas Xmas decorations concerned, they just opened their new tower, the day we were there the TV crews were all over filming. Ceasars nice, but way too long to walk everywhere, got last minute tickets front row, dead center stage at MGM for David Copperfield, he was standing 6 inches from us for most of the show and shook hands with us at the end of the show, he had his parents in the theatre, nice looking older couple, it was his very first show of his stay there, worth the $200.00 for 2 tickets, for sure! I still can't figure out how he actually made it to the beach in Phucket, Thailand and back, in less than 4 minutes, live right in front of our eyes! with satellite feed live from Thailand, hard to fake, with polaroid taken on stage in Vegas, and felt pen markings on his forearm by audience member to ensure same time/day can't be faked!Fashion Show Mall on the strip worth the visit, and nice break from all the Casinos! Imperial Palace a dump, would never go back there, shows it's age, but Legends in Concert Show, worth the 1/2 price tickets we got from the Tickets 1/2 price outlet down the strip for $19.99 very good show, tight band, 10 dancers, great performers, Aretha Franlkin loook a like had the best voice, was a knockout singer worth the admission, Elton John, Look alike was dead ringer, even the gap in front teeth!The drawback of going Christmas week is many of the headliner shows are dark, as performers are off for Christmas.Prime Rib dinner at Prime Rib Loft at Orleans Hotel, for $11.95 best bargain in Vegas!

reviews.title: Ups and Downs but will be back..cuz this place kicks rump
reviews.text: The Rio has always been a fantastic establishment, and recently when we stayed there it was service on a 1st class basis. However, then the unthinkable occured! On the morning of our checkout there is a knock on the door at 8:15 am, and as I look through the peephole in the door, there is a security guard out front. So, I open the door and all of a sudden get the Wyatt Earp reception from the security guard who simply states there is a problem with your hotel bill. And then proceeds to tell me he is there to "lock out the room" and proceeds to enter all the while mantaining a demanor which was not necessary. Too top it off my wife is in the shower and has just gotten out and cannot egress to get her clothes! All the while the security guard tells me to call the front desk which I then proceeded to do and find out the manager has sent a security guard up to our room for a $200.00 bill issue which is not warrented. I mean we have not even checked out yet! So after advising the manager we now have a problem as this was upsetting to my wife in the most demeaning way, the manager then proceeds to advise me of The Rio's hotel policy (which based upon this situation occuring is seriously flawed) and all the while being indifferent to the situation. This was unacceptable to me, and then during the conversation once again I advise her why is there a security guard in my room? She then makes a connection and states "there is a secuirty guard in your room" of which I reply after several minutes of previous conversation with this "manager" yes!

reviews.title: I'd go again in a heartbeat - but...
reviews.text: At that point I handed the phone to the security guard who proceeds to discuss a 419 code issue which who knows what it means. Subsequently seconds later he hands me the phone after speaking with the manager and proceeds to apologize for the error in the most emphatic way. I dont blame him I blame the management.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great stay at the Rio but since we were given a Masquerade suite it was hard not to have a good time. This was an end suite with a 180 degree view. It was wonderful. The suite had a Jacuzzi facing the window with a view of the strip. Room service was fast and fresh. I was lucky enough to get tickets to see the opening night of the Producers and had a great time. We have been to Rio in the past and it remains one of our favorite hotels. The shuttle to the strip is very useful and reliable.
reviews.title: Rio great stay

reviews.text: I wanted to stay at the Rio because they have large rooms and great views. When I went to check in I had three requests non smoking, King bed, and a high floor. I am told all they have is a smoking room with two Queen on the fourth floor. While I am standing waiting to finish my check-in the line next to me opens up and they give him a room on the 18th floor. When I get to my room the won't work I go back to the front desk they give me a new key still does not work they send someone up with a master key to let me in still does not work they have a maint guy come he gets the door open. I go into the room and unpack while the guy works on the door. After an hour he say the door is working I try my key still does not work. the guy tells me I need a new key they send up a Bell Hop with a new key does not work. The Bell Hop says he will send back up Maintenance guy back up never shows up I wait an hour and call the front desk they say they have to move me to a new room so I pack up my things and move. I try get a Elton John ticket from a host but didn,t have the play to get it free no big deal so I tell her I will pay for it and I give her a credit card they charge my card twice for the show the tried to charge me a thrid time when I checked out.
reviews.title: Not so Great

reviews.text: Not a great time
reviews.title: As good as the strip
Super experience at the RIO!!
reviews.text: Jamie Tampa, FL

reviews.title: The Rio - Not as bad as I read
reviews.text: We booked a room for 2 nights at the rio. Ive always wanted to stayed here since its an all suite resort. I loved my stay. The rooms were really spacious. The service was awsome. The buffet is the best one in vegas. Theres no need to leave the Rio for entertainment since it has alot @ the Rio. The only bad thing about it its the location. But it doesnt really matter its like 3-5 mins from the strip. I will always stay here when I have a chance. love the Rio.

Well we went over christmas from saturday(23)-monday(25). we dont celebrate and we were all off, so why not go to vegas. sunday was comped, and sat was $60. thats a bargain. well its pretty close to the strip, it has the free shuttle, and when getting there i requested 2 queens they ran out and said they only had 2 smoking queens, so the manager came and found us a room with 2 queens, it was in the older tower lookin at palms. well the curtain thing was broken called 3 times to get it fixed no one did. well it was a clean hotel, clean casino, great location, the service wasnt that good. not too crowded, a great place. if your having a problem with them just get the manager. and book online, b.c then your prefrences are saved there, otherwise on the telephone youll tell them but they wont record it.
reviews.title: A Great Place

likes.liked: — The rooms, and the cleanliness of the hotel

reviews.title: Nice visit
reviews.text: I stayed in a comped masquerade suite for 4 nights. The room was very nice and had a great bathroom. The only problem in the bathroom was we couldnt get hot water in the stall shower unless we filled up the jacuzzi tub how my wife figured it out I dont know. We called downstairs but they never did anything about it. I laughed because the desk person asked if I ran the shower for 15 minutes first. I never in my life needed to run a shower for 15 minutes to get hot water and this was a premiun rio suite that goes for 600 plus a night. The casino was never really crowded at the slots but the tables got very crowded. I dont think you can have a bad time at the rio but I prefer a little more upscale hotel. I usually stay at the mgm skylofts or the mirage. I stayed at the rio because I was comped the masquerade suite for the stay from my Atlantic City host.

I just got back yesterday from RIO. We had a wonderful stay at RIO. The reception was very nice and acommodated any thing I want. My room was huge and beautiful. It was at Ipanema Tower. And this tower is a new renowvated tower, (if you book you should request room on this side, most of the room are new ly upgraded)... My room faced to LasVegas trip and swimming pool side. At night we can see a whole las vegas city through all glass window wall. We feel like we are living in a millionare's house or something.... It's worth it at a cheap price $75/per night for a suite like this....that I booked through //www.harrahs.com. It was beautiful and romantic room. My husband & my daughter love the room a lot too... Mable bathroom, funiture is a highend quality .... We like every things there.... and difinitely we will be back there next time.. I am highly recommend you this hotel...
reviews.title: Love Rio, great stay & beautiful room !!

likes.liked: — big room with a nice big open glass window, marble bathroom, refigerator..

reviews.text: Overall, I would say our stay was very good. We had a nice suite on the 18th floor looking toward the strip. The room was big and very clean with a fridge, ironing board, safe, couch and table. No problem with maid service. The door key was a constant problem though. At least 3 times I had to go back to the front desk to get another key. This is not fun when you've been out on the and all you want to do is fall into bed and pass out.
reviews.title: Watch those extra charges

reviews.text: One thing you must do even if not staying there is take the glass elevator up to the Voodoo Lounge on the 51st floor. There is a 2 level outdoor deck with an amazing view of all Las Vegas. No cover charge before 9pm, I believe.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for first time in Vegas

likes.liked: — Room size, cleanliness and comfort as well as Prince performing there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked using their Hot deals.
reviews.title: Suites not all that great but provides a roof

likes.liked: — The room, its size and the comfort.

reviews.text: I enjoy their casino and their buffet. I must say their seafood buffet is overrated tho but their carnavel buffet has a good standard despite having a fantastic wide spread.
reviews.title: not that great

reviews.text: I got to stay in the Masquerade Towers but it must be noted this hotel doesnt provide the best "view" since it is away from the strip. The room was decent although the safe was spoilt.
reviews.title: RIO was fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was great although I got assigned a room which haven't got made up.
reviews.title: Love the Rio

likes.disliked: — older room furniture and fair to poor view

reviews.text: It provides shuttles to the strip with 3 stops harrahs/caesars/ballys each about 20mins each. Cab from the airport will cost $15-$20.
reviews.title: Nicer than the Imperial Palace

description: Spacious suites and luxurious amenities complement the gaming thrills, sumptuous dining and hot entertainment found at Rio. The excitement of Carnival radiates throughout the casino floor and out to the pools of VooDoo Beach where guests can soak up the sun in both family-friendly and adults-only areas. Inside, guests can dine at Martorano’s, an Italian restaurant serving the world’s greatest meatballs, or experience the city’s finest panoramic views at VooDoo Steak. Rio’s Carnival World and Village Seafood buffets have been voted the city’s best and shouldn’t be missed. Crown Theater, a nightclub and live music venue, books everyone from Platters, Cornell Gunter Coasters & Marvelettes to Devo. Of course, you may prefer to dance above the lights and under the stars at VooDoo Rooftop Nightclub. Back on the ground, entertainers Penn & Teller and the Chippendales keep audiences enraptured nightly.
